comments:
Overview Description:

Eclipse 3.1 does not start on Windows XP, but stops with an error message.

No output on console. Log file says "Unable to acquire application service". See
below for complete log file.

Steps:

Starting eclipse.exe from a clean unpacked zip-file gives the message "An error
occurred. See the log file ...".

Solutions already tried:

As suggested in other bug reports.

C:\Documents and Settings\Edwin\Desktop\eclipse>eclipse -vm "C:\Program
Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_04\bin\javaw"

C:\Documents and Settings\Edwin\Desktop\eclipse>eclipse -vm "C:\Program
Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_04\bin\javaw" -data "C:\Documents and Settings\Edwin\Desktop"

C:\Documents and Settings\Edwin\Desktop\eclipse>eclipse -vm "C:\Program
Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_04\bin\javaw" -vmargs -Dorg.eclipse.core.runtime.ignoreLockFile

C:\Documents and Settings\Edwin\Desktop\eclipse>eclipse -vm "C:\Program
Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_04\bin\javaw" -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=java.io

Hardware/software:

Intel 1.1GHz, 512MB RAM
Windows XP service pack 2

Special circumtances:

None. No shared disks, no old JVM's, no strange environment variables.

Contents of log file:

!SESSION 2005-06-30 12:50:33.958 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=nl_NL
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-06-30 12:50:34.810
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

By "clean unpacked" I assume you extracted Eclipse ZIP file to an empty
location. Is that correct?

Also, are you sure you downloaded the Eclipse SDK or Platform, and not the
Eclipse RCP SDK (which does not have an application)? The SDK has more than 90
plug-ins under the <eclipse>/plugins directory. The RCP SDK has less than 20.

If your answer was "yes" for both questions above, try the following: launch
Eclipse with -console -consolelog -noExit (you must run with java.exe, not
javaw.exe):

eclipse -debug -noexit -consolelog -console

After the failure happens, you should be left at the "osgi>" prompt. Typing
"ss<enter>" should produce a listing of all installed plug-ins and their states.
Please attach the full output (everything printed out since Eclipse started) to
this PR. Thanks.

I did download and tried the Eclipse RCP SDK (I probably got confused by the
large list of files).

I see the download-link on the homepage links directly to the right SDK-file,
that's better.

Sorry for wasting your time.
